1.text: And the Naainathite will answer and say,

2.text: For this my thoughts will turn back, and because of my haste in me.

3.text: I shall hear the instruction of my shame, and the spirit of my understanding will cause me to answer.

4.text: Thou knewest this from everlasting when man was set upon the earth:

5.text: For the rejoicing of the unjust drawing near, and the gladness of the profane even for a moment.

6.text: If his elevation shall go up to the heavens, and his head shall reach to the cloud;

7.text: As his dung he shall perish forever: they seeing him shall say, Where is he?

8.text: As a dream he shall fly away, and they shall not find him: and he shall flee away as the vision of the night.

9.text: The eye scanned him and shall not add; and his place shall no more look after him.

10.text: The weak shall break his sons, and his hands shall turn back his wealth.

11.text: His bones were full of his youth, and shall lie down with him in the dust.

12.text: If evil shall be sweet in his mouth he will cover it under his tongue;

13.text: He will spare over it, and forsake it not, and keep it back in the midst of his palate:

14.text: His bread in his bowels was turned, the gall of asps in his midst.

15.text: He swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit it up, and God shall drive it out of his belly.

16.text: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viperâ€™s tongue shall kill him.

17.text: He shall not look upon the streams, the rivers, the torrents of honey and curdled milk.

18.text: Turning back the labor, and he shall not swallow down: according to the substance of his exchange and he shall not exult.

19.text: For he oppressed, forsaking the poor; he stripped the house and he will not build it up.

20.text: For he knew not tranquillity in his belly, in his desire he shall not escape.

21.text: Nothing was left to his food; for this his good shall not be stable.

22.text: In the fulness of his abundance it shall be pressed to him: every laboring hand shall come to him.

23.text: He will be for filling his belly, he will send upon him the burning of his anger, and will rain upon him in his eating.

24.text: He shall flee from the weapon of iron, the bow of brass shall pierce him.

25.text: Being drawn it will come forth from the body; and the lightning will go from his bile, and terrors upon him.

26.text: All darkness hid for his secret places: a fire not blown upon shall devour him; and the remaining one shall do evil upon his tent.

27.text: The heavens shall uncover his iniquity, and the earth an adversary against him.

28.text: The increase of his house shall be rolled off; they were poured out in the day of his anger.

29.text: This the portion of an unjust man and the lot of his command from God.
